org.gearvrf

Class GVRResourceVolume

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRResourceVolume

  • public class GVRResourceVolume
extends java.lang.Object
    Models a file system which supports stream I/O.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GVRResourceVolume

        public GVRResourceVolume(GVRContext gvrContext,
                         GVRResourceVolume.VolumeType volume)
        Constructor. Creates a GVRResourceVolume object based on a volume type.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - The GVR Context.
        volume - The volume type.

      • GVRResourceVolume

        public GVRResourceVolume(GVRContext context,
                         GVRAndroidResource resource)
        Constructor. Creates a GVRResourceVolume object based on a resource. This form of the constructor gets the volume type and the volume path from the filename in the resource. This form of the constructor maintains the resource filename and can provide it later via @{link #getFileName() }. If a volume is opened using a GVRAndroidResource that references a file using an Android resource ID, other files that are referenced by that volume (textures, MTL files) are assumed to be in res/raw.
        Parameters:
        context - The GVR Context.
        resource - GVRAndroidResource residing on the volume. This resource is added to the internal resource map of this volume so it can be opened based on only the filename using GVRResourceVolume.openResource.
        See Also:
        getFileName()

      • GVRResourceVolume

        public GVRResourceVolume(GVRContext context,
                         java.lang.String filename)
        Constructor. Creates a GVRResourceVolume object based on a filename. This form of the constructor maintains the filename and can provide it later via @{link #getFileName() }.
        Parameters:
        filename - A filename, relative to the root of the volume. If the filename starts with "sd:" the file is assumed to reside on the SD Card. If the filename starts with "http:" or "https:" it is assumed to be a URL. Otherwise the file is assumed to be relative to the "assets" directory.
        context - The GVR Context.
        See Also:
        getFileName()

      • GVRResourceVolume

        public GVRResourceVolume(GVRContext gvrContext,
                         GVRResourceVolume.VolumeType volumeType,
                         java.lang.String defaultPath)
        Constructor. Creates a GVRResourceVolume object based on a volume type, and a default path.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - The GVR Context.
        volumeType - The volume type. See GVRResourceVolume.VolumeType.
        defaultPath - The default path which specifies the 'root' directory of the volume.

      • GVRResourceVolume

        public GVRResourceVolume(GVRContext gvrContext,
                         GVRResourceVolume.VolumeType volumeType,
                         java.lang.String defaultPath,
                         boolean cacheEnabled)
        Constructor. Creates a GVRResourceVolume object based on a volume type, and a default path.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - The GVR Context.
        volumeType - The volume type. See GVRResourceVolume.VolumeType.
        defaultPath - The default path which specifies the 'root' directory of the volume.
        cacheEnabled - Set to true for enabling cache for network files.

    • Method Detail

      • addResource

        public GVRAndroidResource addResource(GVRAndroidResource resource)
        Adds an android resource to the volume's resource map. This function is useful if you have created the GVRAndroidResource from a resource ID but would like to read it via it's filename. If you add the resource first, you can call openResource() on it's filename.
        Parameters:
        resource - Android resource to open.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • openResource

        public GVRAndroidResource openResource(java.lang.String filePath)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Opens a file from the volume. The filePath is relative to the defaultPath.
        Parameters:
        filePath - File path of the resource to open.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • adaptFilePath

        protected java.lang.String adaptFilePath(java.lang.String filePath)
        Adapt a file path to the current file system.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The input file path string.
        Returns:
        File path compatible with the file system of this GVRResourceVolume.

      • changeDefaultPath

        public void changeDefaultPath(java.lang.String defaultPath)
        Changes the default path.
        Parameters:
        defaultPath - The path to change to.

        protected java.lang.String getFullPath(java.lang.String... path)
